section.title: Vehicle features and options
section.paragraph: This chapter describes model-specific equipment, systems and functions that are available now and will be available in the future, even if they are not available in the owned vehicle.
Additional information:
Vehicle equipment.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: Remote Software Upgrade can be used to update the entire software of the vehicle. This makes new functions, functional enhancements or quality improvements available.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: BMW recommends performing the Remote Software Upgrade as soon as it becomes available.

overview.overview-text: Do not leave children or animals unattended in the vehicle

warning.paragraph: Unattended children or animals in the vehicle can cause the vehicle to move and endanger themselves and traffic, for instance due to the following actions:

item.paragraph: Pressing the Start/Stop button.
Releasing the parking brake.
Opening and closing the doors or windows.
Engaging selector lever position N.
Using vehicle equipment.

warning.paragraph: There is a risk of accidents or injuries. Do not leave children or animals unattended in the vehicle. Take the vehicle key with you when exiting and lock the vehicle.

item.paragraph: Active ConnectedDrive contract.
The integrated SIM card in the vehicle has been activated.
Cellular network reception.
Consent to transmit the corresponding data was given in the Data Protection menu.
Additional information:
Data protection.

section.title: Functional requirement
section.paragraph: Standby must be turned on to search for a Remote Software Upgrade.

section.title: Automatic search
section.paragraph: The vehicle regularly searches for updates in the background.

action-step.paragraph: Follow the instructions on the Control Display.

section.title: Automatic download
section.paragraph: If available, the data for a Remote Software Upgrade is automatically downloaded to the vehicle. No download consent is required.

section.title: Via BMW app
section.paragraph: If an upgrade is available, information about the new software version is displayed in the BMW app.
The data for the upgrade can then be downloaded to a mobile device, for instance via an existing WLAN connection.
The data can then be transmitted from the mobile device to the vehicle.
This transmission method accelerates the download of the data, for instance in areas with limited mobile network availability.

action-step.paragraph: Download the upgrade in the BMW app to the smartphone.
Follow the instructions in the BMW app.

item.paragraph: iOS: connect Bluetooth audio and WLAN.
Android: connect Bluetooth® audio and WLAN.

action-step.paragraph: The data transfer of the upgrade from the mobile device to the vehicle occurs in the background only while driving.
Follow the instructions on the Control Display.

section.paragraph: Additional information:
Connecting mobile devices to the vehicle.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The information about the version contains a description of the updates included in the Remote Software Upgrade. During the download and after the installation has been successfully completed, the information about the version can be displayed on the Control Display.
This information is also available in the ConnectedDrive customer portal.

section.title: Displaying information
section.paragraph: Display in the vehicle:

item.paragraph: Display currently installed version:
Display new available version:

action-step.paragraph: Follow the instructions on the Control Display.

section.paragraph: Display in the ConnectedDrive customer portal:
www.bmw-connecteddrive.com.

item.paragraph: Installation of the Remote Software Upgrade may result in the deletion of software changes, e.g., performance increases not made by the manufacturer of the vehicle.
Modifications to the electrical system of the vehicle, for instance to control units, that have not been made by the vehicle manufacturer can lead to an interruption of the installation.
The installation does not occur until the consent was given.
The installation may take around 20 to 30 minutes.
The installation may take around 20 minutes.
The installation cannot be terminated.
The vehicle cannot be used during the installation.
The vehicle can be exited during the installation.
Charging the vehicle is interrupted due to the installation.
Following the successful installation, charging the vehicle may not continue automatically.

section.title: Prerequisites for the installation

item.paragraph: The state of charge of the vehicle battery is sufficient.
The outside temperature is above -10 ℃-10 ℃, 14 ℉14 ℉/-10 ℃.
The vehicle is parked in a horizontal position.
The hazard warning system is turned off.
The selector lever position P is engaged.
The engine is turned off and sufficiently cooled down.
Drive-ready state is switched off.

section.paragraph: If applicable, follow the notes for further prerequisites on the control display.
If the prerequisites are not met, such as a sufficient vehicle battery charge state, the upgrade will not be offered for installation.
Pay attention to an offer for installation, e.g., after longer trips.
Pay attention to an offer for installation, e.g., after charging the battery for a longer period of time.

item.paragraph: Park the vehicle safely away from the public road.
Cellular network reception must be ensured so that a fault message can be sent to the vehicle manufacturer, for instance if the installation is terminated.
Close the windows.
Close the glass sunroof.
Close the trunk.
Remove energy consuming devices, such as a mobile phone.
Disconnect any trailer or load carrier.
The vehicle key must be located in the vehicle for the consent for installation.
Switch off the exterior lighting.
Remove the devices connected to the diagnostic socket.

section.title: Installing immediately
section.paragraph: The upgrade can be installed immediately when all prerequisites have been met.

action-step.paragraph: Follow the instructions on the Control Display.

section.title: Installing with timer
section.paragraph: When the trip is completed, a timer can be used to install the upgrade automatically at a configured time, such as during the night. A later installation may make sense to meet functional requirements, e.g., a sufficiently cooled down engine.

When the trip is completed, a timer can be used to install the upgrade automatically at a configured time, such as during the night. A later installation may make sense to meet functional requirements, e.g., a sufficiently charged vehicle battery.
The installation starts automatically when:

item.paragraph: All prerequisites for the installation have been established correctly.
All prerequisites continue to be met at the time of installation.

section.paragraph: The timer is turned off when the drive-ready state is turned on.

section.title: Functional limitations
section.paragraph: During the upgrade, the majority of functions is temporarily unavailable, for instance:

item.paragraph: Hazard warning system.
Central locking system and, if necessary, Comfort Access.
Parking lights.
Horn.
Alarm system.
Emergency call.
Power windows.
Glass sunroof.
Checking the fuel filler flap lock.
Operate the tailgate or trunk lid.
Lock the tailgate.
Exit warning if needed.

section.paragraph: In vehicles with frameless doors, the window may no longer close completely.
The driver's door can be locked and unlocked from the outside using the integrated key.
In vehicles with an electrical lock, the lock may temporarily not work. In this case, the vehicle can be exited by unlocking the driver's door manually.
Additional information:
Buttons for central locking system.

section.title: After successful upgrade
section.paragraph: The vehicle can be used again immediately.
Booked services such as. Advanced Real Time Traffic Information or Remote Services are automatically reactivated during the next trip.
After an extended stationary period, charge the vehicle battery with an extended drive.
After a longer stationary period, recharge the vehicle battery with the charging cable as necessary.

section.title: Malfunction
section.paragraph: In the event of a malfunction, follow the instructions on the control display or in the BMW app.
If the malfunction cannot be remedied, contact an authorized service center or another qualified service center or a repair shop.

section.title: Production of the vehicle
section.paragraph: At the time of production at the plant, the printed Owner's Manual is the most current resource.

section.title: After a software update in the vehicle
section.paragraph: After a vehicle software update, such as via Remote Software Upgrade, the Integrated Owner's Manual for the vehicle will contain the latest information.
